title: #DataProtectionLoSCapabilities.DataProtectionLoSCapabilities

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Name.description: A friendly name for this line of service.
Name.longDescription: If present, the name shall be a friendly name for this line of service.

RecoveryGeographicObjective.longDescription: The value specifies the geograhic scope of the failure domain.

RecoveryPointObjective.description: Time interval defining how much source data that can be lost on failure.
RecoveryPointObjective.longDescription: The value of each entry shall be an ISO 8601 duration that shall specify a bound on the the amount of source data that can be lost on failure.

RecoveryTimeObjective.description: Time to access an alternate replica.
RecoveryTimeObjective.longDescription: The maximum time required to access an alternate replica shall be less than this time interval.

ReplicaType.longDescription: The type of replica shall conform to this value.

MinLifetime.description: Minimum lifetime (seconds) that replica must be maintained.
MinLifetime.longDescription: The value of each entry shall be an ISO 8601 duration that shall specify the minimum supported lifetime. Note: The maximum number of replicas can be determined using this value together with the replicaSchedule.

IsIsolated.description: The replica is in a separate fault domain.
IsIsolated.longDescription: True shall indicate that the replica is in a separate fault domain from its source. The default value of this property is false.

Schedule.description: A schedule for making periodic point in time replicas.
Schedule.longDescription: If a replica is made periodically, the value shall define the schedule.

ReplicaAccessLocation.description: Location that supplies data access to the replica.
ReplicaAccessLocation.longDescription: This value shall be used if the data access location of the replica is required to be at a specific location.   Note 1: The location value may be granular.  Note 2: A value may be required for some regulatory compliance.

ReplicaClassOfService.longDescription: The value shall reference the class of service that defines the required service levels of the replica.

DataProtectionLineOfService.description: Describes a data protection service option.
DataProtectionLineOfService.longDescription: This service option describes a replica that protects data from loss. The requirements must be met collectively by the communication path and the replica.

enumDescriptions.Rack: A container for Servers, Networking, and Storage.
enumDescriptions.RackGroup: A set of Racks that share common infrastructure.
enumDescriptions.Datacenter: A co-located set of servers, including network and storage that share communication, power, or cooling infrastructure.
enumDescriptions.Region: A geographical or politically isolated set of resources.

enumLongDescriptions.Server: Components of a CPU/memory complex that share the same infrastructure.
enumLongDescriptions.Rack: A container within a datacenter that provides communication, power, or cooling to a set of components.
enumLongDescriptions.RackGroup: A set of racks that may share common communication, power, or cooling.
enumLongDescriptions.Row: A set of adjacent racks or rackgroups that may share common communication, power, or cooling.
enumLongDescriptions.Datacenter: A facility that provides communication, power, or cooling infrastructure to a co-located set of servers, networking and storage.
enumLongDescriptions.Region: A set of resources that are required to be either geographically or politically isolated from resources not in the resources.

FailureDomainScope.description: Values of this enumeration represent a geographic scope of a failure domain.
FailureDomainScope.longDescription: The enumeration literals of this enumeration shall represent a geographic scope in which all components within that scope have similar vulnerabilities.

enumDescriptions.Online: Passive access to replicas via the same front-end interconnect.
enumDescriptions.Nearline: Access to replica via a different front-end interconnect. A restore step is required before recovery can commence.
enumDescriptions.Offline: No direct connection to the replica. (i.e. To a bunker containing backup media.)

enumLongDescriptions.Immediate: Access to synchronous replicas shall be instantaneous.
enumLongDescriptions.Online: Access to a synchronous replica shall be consistent with switching access to a different path the same front-end interconnect.  A restore step shall not be required.
enumLongDescriptions.Nearline: Access to a replica shall be consistent with switching access to a different path through a different front-end interconnection infrastructure.  Some inconsistency may occur.  A restore step may be required before recovery can commence.
enumLongDescriptions.Offline: Access to a replica may take a significant amount of time.  No direct connection to the replica is assumed. Some inconsistency loss may occur.  A restore step is likely to be required.

RecoveryAccessScope.description: An enumeration that represents the relative time required to make a replica available as a source.
RecoveryAccessScope.longDescription: The enumeration literals shall represent the relative time required to make a replica available as a source.
